description: The bus was carrying members of a Mexican soccer team when the driver lost control as the vehicle travelled over a bridge and plunged off a ravine into a deep gorge below.
title: Bus carrying members of a Mexican soccer team plunges off ravine into a deep gorge
title_page: Bus carrying members of a Mexican soccer team plunges off ravine into a deep gorge | Daily Mail Online
text:
At least 20 people have died after a bus carrying a Mexican soccer team plunged off a ravine and fell into a deep gorge below.
The head of the civil defense office in the Gulf coast state of Veracruz, Yolanda Guttierrez, says the accident saw 20 of the 45 people on board die.
She added that the bus was apparently carrying members of a soccer team when it skidded off a bridge near the city of Cordoba.
At least 20 people have died after a bus carrying a Mexican soccer team plunged off a ravine and fell into a deep gorge below
Rescue workers remove the body of a passenger who died when a bus plunged off a bridge in Mexico after the driver lost control
The Veracruz state government said it was likely the bus was speeding and that the driver lost control when going over a speed bump.
The vehicle then plunged off the bridge, which is more than 100 feet high on the Atoyac-Paso del Macho highway in Atoyac.
It is understood the bus was heading from Camaron de Tejeda to Cordoba, where the team was going to play a match.
Pictures from the scene showed rescue workers help pull survivors out of the wreckage and transport them to hospitals in Cordoba, a city more than 155 miles from Mexico City.
Rescue workers were seen pulling bodies from the wreckage of the bus after it crashed. The Veracruz state government said it was likely the bus was speeding and that the driver lost control when going over a speed bump
A survivor of the crash struggles to contain his emotion as bodies are pulled from the ravine after the crash in Cordoba
They were also pictured pulling the bodies of those who died from the crumpled remains of the bus.
It was unclear if the driver survived.
Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto expressed his condolences to the victims' families in his Twitter account.
Locals look on over the side of the ravine where the wreckage of the bus lay as rescue workers pulled bodies from the crumpled vehicle
He said: 'I regret the tragic accident at the bridge of Atoyac, Veracruz, in which several people were killed.
'My condolences to your loved ones and wishes of speedy recovery to the injured.'
